decks.notes: The focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Utilizing efficient creatures like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game. With cards like Goblin Bombardment for direct damage and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck emphasizes a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle to secure victory. Additionally, cards like Guide of Souls and Thraben Charm provide additional utility and versatility in different situations.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with big creatures like Ulamog, the Defiler and Griselbrand using cards like Faithless Looting and Goryo's Vengeance, then bring them back onto the battlefield with Fallaji Archaeologist. By utilizing instant reanimation and card manipulation, the deck can surprise opponents with powerful creatures early in the game. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and protect the combo. The strategy revolves around leveraging the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent with unstoppable threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. With a strong control element thanks to cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant board presence. The deck also features artifact synergies with cards like Mystic Forge and Sowing Mycospawn, allowing for consistent card advantage and mana acceleration. Overall, the deck excels at controlling the game and overwhelming opponents with powerful Eldrazi threats.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Galvanic Discharge to put pressure on the opponent early. Showdown of the Skalds and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional ways to create a wide board presence and pump up the team. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison to slow down the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy and ensure consistent color access for spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to protect its own threats while gradually building card advantage and out-valuing the opponent. Murktide Regent serves as a powerful win condition that can quickly close out games, while cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push provide early interaction. The deck also utilizes a variety of graveyard synergies and instant-speed spells to stay ahead in card advantage and maintain control of the game.
